attributes.action: scrap the proposed 1% increase in all National Insurance contributions, and instead remove the Upper Earnings Limit for high earners, making the system fairer.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The way National Insurance contributions are currently structured is inherently unfair. Earnings upto around £44,000 per annum attract deductions of 11%. Above this amount, the Upper Earnings Limit, there is only a 1% deduction. Therefore, someone earning £50,000 would pay only 1% on the £6,000 above £44,000. In simple terms, this means those earning around £50,000 pay the same proportion of their salary in National Insurance contributions as those earning £25,000, whilst Premiership footballers, bankers, et al, earning £500,000+ pay only around twice that of those earning £50,000. Rather than imposing the additional 1% tax on everyone earning over £5700 per year, it seems fairer and more sensible to remove the upper limit for high earners.
